column4: to run ssh in my server, what do i need to install??? openssh??? or just ssh?? i forgot... i'm building a tutorial
so to run it i just need openssh???
what exactly are you trying to do?
i'm already doing it, i'm just writing a tutorial, and i need to know exactly the comands... i need to install @ the server, openssh... and what about ssh?
you need to install the server on the server, and the client on the client.
i forgot what i have installed grr...
openssh-server is the server, openssh is the client
i don't know if i installed openssh server, but it's running...
at ubuntu server... i install openssh-server, and at the normal pc... openssh... is that it?
no, openssh-server is the service you connect to.  openssh is the client you use to connect to the server with.
you can install openssh-server on any ubuntu system
but what's the difference if i type sudo apt-get install openssh, or openssh-server, or just ssh?
fyi, there are a LOT of great articles on how to do amazing things with ssh.  ssh is one of the most powerful tools that linux has.
so i'll write at my tutorial that the user should run at server and client, sudo apt-get install ssh, and everything will be ok right?
